allow: Bash(git -C packages/bible commit -m "Add package README with chapter list and build commands")
Bash(git -C packages/dont-make-ai-think commit -m "Add package README with implementation focus")
Bash(git -C packages/shared-appendices commit -m "Add package README with appendices list")
Bash(git -C outputs commit -m "Add multi-repo architecture blog post")

Bash(git -C packages/bible commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Rewrite Chapter 0 with narrative-first approach

Changed structure from technical taxonomy to personal discovery journey:
- Opening section now tells the story of how this work began \(CMS conferences, blog posts, conversations with Matt Bailey\)
- Moved from "They 're Machines, Not Magic" opening to "The Journey" opening
- Added concrete examples upfront \(Danube cruise pricing, Ally McBeal legal citations\)
- Introduced "invisible users" concept through narrative rather than technical definition
- Restructured agent types section to follow discovery journey
- Added personal context about publishing plans, website strategy, broader CMS industry implications

Content changes:
- Reduced from ~277 lines to ~145 lines \(more focused, less repetitive\)
- Maintained all technical accuracy while improving readability
- Added metadata table with enhanced longdescription and purpose fields
- Preserved all footnote references and implementation support section

Rationale: This makes Chapter 0 more engaging as standalone introduction while maintaining technical depth. Narrative approach helps readers understand why this work matters before explaining technical details.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -C packages/dont-make-ai-think commit -m "Fix markdown linting errors in Chapter 8

- Fix MD040: Add language specification to all code blocks \(text\)
- Fix MD036: Convert emphasis to proper headings \(### Test 1, ### Phase 1, etc.\)
- Fix MD034: Wrap bare URLs in angle brackets \(auto-fixed\)
- Fix MD032: Add blank lines around lists \(auto-fixed\)

All 24 linting errors resolved, chapter now passes markdownlint validation.")

Bash(git -C packages/bible commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add MX dedicated roles section to Chapter 0

Add comprehensive explanation of why Machine Experience \(MX\) requires dedicated professional roles, addressing the organizational psychology principle "if it's everyone's job, nobody does it".

New content covers:
- Diffusion of responsibility research \(85% → 31% response rates\)
- DevOps/QA parallel: shared awareness + dedicated specialists
- Three-tier accountability structure \(specialists, distributed awareness, executive ownership\)
- MX/accessibility convergence enabling role expansion vs new headcount
- Commercial urgency from January 2026 platform launches

Includes three footnotes with research citations from organizational psychology, DevOps implementations, and accountability frameworks.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -C packages/bible commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Move Chapter 0 to main repository as shared content

Chapter 0 \(What Are AI Agents?\) serves as a shared introduction across
all books in the Invisible Users series. Moved to main repository at
docs/shared-chapters/chapter-00-what-are-ai-agents.md to reflect its
role as global content.

Changes:
- Removed chapters/chapter-00-what-are-ai-agents.md \(now in main repo\)
- Updated README.md with note about Chapter 0 location
- Fixed chapter numbering in contents list \(1-13 instead of 1,3-14\)

This aligns with the multi-book architecture where shared content
lives in the main repository rather than individual book repositories.
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -C outputs commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Remove blog files relocated to main repo docs

The architecting multi-repo blog content has been moved from outputs/bible/blogs/ to docs/for-ai/ in the main repository for better discoverability and version control alongside other AI documentation.

EOF
\)")

Bash(git -C packages/shared-appendices commit -m "Replace EDS metadata tables with Pandoc YAML frontmatter

- Appendix L Pattern 4: Complete rewrite from ''EDS Markdown Metadata Tables'' to ''Pandoc YAML Frontmatter''
  - Updated status from ''Proposed - Adobe EDS'' to ''Established Standard - Universal''
  - Replaced all table examples with YAML frontmatter format
  - Updated rationale, use cases, benefits, forward compatibility, adoption considerations
  - Added Pandoc documentation reference
  - Updated cross-references throughout appendix \(lines 30, 885, 974\)
- Appendix H: Added new section ''Markdown Metadata Standards for AI Agents''
  - Explains how YAML frontmatter complements llms.txt
  - Provides standard Pandoc fields and custom AI agent fields
  - Includes platform support details \(Hugo, Jekyll, Gatsby, Quarto, Pandoc\)
  - Added build system integration examples
  - Links to Pandoc documentation resource

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>")
